module.name: functional_decomposition_to_design
module.keywords: module, electrical, layered product, analysis, synthesis, simulation, packaging application, library pin mapping

abstract.p: the representation of the information needed to describe the assignment of a functional unit in a hierarchical network definition to an element in the physical design definition. Usually, this information is provided by a packaging application.
the pin mapping between the functional view and the packaged view that is normally stored in a library and which the packaging application traverses during execution.
abstract.li: identification of swapping of the allocation of functional unit to a physical design component with a different allocation;
identification of swapping of the allocation of terminals of a functional unit to a physical design component with a different allocation.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of the information needed to describe the assignment of a functional unit in a hierarchical network definition to an element in the physical design definition. Usually, this information is provided by a packaging application.

This part of ISO 10303 provides the pin mapping between the functional view and the packaged view that is normally stored in a library and which the packaging application traverses during execution. The pin map may not be a simple direct allocation as a hierarchical network definition may be needed to represent the functional definition.

This module defines the different means of describing swapping accomplished within a design. The types of swapping covered are the ones between gates in a single package instance, between gates in different package instances, and between terminals in a gate. Constraints on swapping are not included in this module.

The terminals swapped with this module are on the functional elements in the hierarchical design network listing and not the flattened network listing. Applications that perform swapping on flattened representations will need to map to the hierarchical representation.
This second edition of this part of ISO 10303 incorporates the modifications to the first edition listed below.
The following ARM EXPRESS declarations and interface specifications have been added:
In addition, modifications have been made to the mapping specification, the MIM schema and the EXPRESS-G diagrams to reflect and be consistent with the modifications of the ARM.

inscope.li: pin mapping between a functional definition and a physical definition;
allocation of a functional unit in a hierarchical network definition to a physical design component;
identification of swapping of the allocation of functional unit to a physical design component with a different allocation;
identification of swapping of the allocation of terminals of a functional unit to a physical design component with a different allocation;
items within the scope of application module Design management, ISO/TS 10303-1661;
items within the scope of application module Network functional design view, ISO/TS 10303-1704;
items within the scope of application module Physical unit design view, ISO/TS 10303-1728.

sc.description: All members of this constraint maps to entity with additional constraints in the mapping. All of them require different target entity for attributes current_design_object and previous_design_object, so ONEOF subtype constraint from ARM is guaranteed as not violated.
